title: Ethereum records more long-term holders than Bitcoin in 2023, on-chain data - FXStreet
summary: Ethereum has more long-term holders than Bitcoin, according to on-chain data. In the last year, there has been a significant rise in long-term holders, with 73.5 million Ethereum holders versus 33.61 million Bitcoin holders. Additionally, Ethereum has more whales, with 5,370 addresses holding between 1,000 to 10,000 ETH, compared to Bitcoin's 1,920 addresses. The percentage of Ethereum and Bitcoin holdings in USD also favors Ethereum. Experts attribute the disparity to Ethereum's decentralized finance (DeFi) space dominance, as it offers more functionality and use cases than Bitcoin.

title: Some Ethereum Staking Services Commit to 22% Self-Limit of Validators - Unchained - Unchained
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in 256 tokens or less:

Some Ethereum staking services have agreed to limit their share of the market to 22% to ensure decentralization. RocketPool, Stakewise, Stader Labs, and Diva Staking have committed to this self-imposed limit. This is seen as a positive step towards network security, as finalization requires 66% of validators to agree on the chain. However, some users have expressed skepticism about the commitment, noting that verbal agreements can easily melt away if one service provider reaches the 22% threshold. Lido, which currently controls 32.4% of the staking market, rejected a self-limit vote in June.

title: Ethereum Registers More Long-term Holders Than Bitcoin in 2023 - Watcher Guru
summary: Ethereum has seen a significant increase in long-term holders in 2023, with 73.9 million holders compared to Bitcoin's 33.6 million. Despite Bitcoin's older status and higher price growth, Ethereum's network evolution and DeFi capabilities have given it an advantage. Ethereum's share of the $38 billion locked in DeFi is substantial, with $22.31 billion compared to Bitcoin's $162.6 million. While Bitcoin has outperformed in terms of price and market cap, Ethereum has attracted more long-term holders.

title: Robinhood (HOOD) Expands Crypto Exposure, Adds Wallet Features - Yahoo Finance
summary: Robinhood, a popular investment app, has expanded its cryptocurrency offerings by adding support for Bitcoin and Dogecoin in its wallet feature. The app now allows users to send and receive these cryptocurrencies, as well as swap them on the Ethereum and Polygon networks. The wallet also charges gas fees for transactions on the Ethereum network. This expansion comes as more banks and financial institutions are starting to embrace cryptocurrencies. Other recent developments in the space include JPMorgan Chase launching a digital asset division and BlackRock partnering with Coinbase to provide institutional clients with access to digital currencies.

title: U.S. Court Calls ETH a Commodity While Tossing Investor Suit Against Uniswap - CoinDesk
summary: U.S. Court: ETH is a Commodity, Dismisses Suit Against Uniswap. Judge: ETH is a commodity, not a security. SEC Chief Gary Gensler has avoided calling ETH a security. Court dismisses suit against Uniswap, ruling true defendants are token issuers, not Uniswap.

title: Relic Protocol ports all of Ethereum's data to layer-2 - Blockworks
summary: Relic Protocol, a blockchain security firm, has developed a trust-minimized solution for smart contracts to access Ethereum's vast historical data. The protocol stores historical data in a compressed format, allowing developers to prove certain past facts without pushing the data on-chain. This could be particularly useful for applications like borrowing and lending markets, where historical price volatility data could be used to tweak lending parameters trustlessly. Other teams, such as Herodotus, are also working on similar solutions to make Ethereum's history more accessible. ChainLight, the developer of Relic Protocol, plans to extend support to more chains and envision a world where the benefits of both Ethereum and zkSync can be seamlessly integrated, offering developers the best of both worlds without sacrificing decentralization.

title: Ethereum Price Prediction for 2023, 2024, 2025, 2030 and Beyond - NewsBTC
summary: Ethereum's price is expected to rise gradually throughout 2023, although it will remain volatile in the short term. The asset has the potential to reach $10,000 to $15,000 per ETH in the next five to ten years, according to some industry experts and analysts. However, it's important to note that Ethereum's price can drop to near zero, and it's not ruled out entirely. The asset is prone to high volatility due to its relatively new status as an asset class. Full-scale mainstream adoption as a blockchain platform could take place within the next 5-10 years, which could stabilize Ethereum's price volatility.

title: Crypto Exchange OKX Reveals $10,400,000,000 in Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH) and USDT Reserves - The Daily Hodl
summary: OKX, a leading cryptocurrency exchange, has revealed that it has a combined $10.4 billion worth of Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH), and stablecoin Tether (USDT) in its reserves. The exchange commits to releasing monthly digital asset proof of reserves audits, allowing customers to see at any time audited proof that their crypto assets are 1:1 backed. The latest audit showed that OKX holds more BTC, ETH, and USDT than its users hold, with a reserve ratio exceeding 100% for ten consecutive months across all assets. A poll on the social media platform X found that 67.5% of voters consider monthly proof of reserves reports "very important," while 79.6% of voters say that transparency is "very important" when choosing a crypto platform to trust.

title: Judge Scraps Lawsuit against Uniswap, Calls Ethereum a Commodity - Finance Magnates
summary: In a recent development, a US judge has dismissed a class-action lawsuit against Uniswap Labs and its CEO, foundation, and venture capital backers. The lawsuit was filed by six crypto investors who claimed that Uniswap controlled its liquidity pools, including those created by scammers, and held "liquidity provider funds and newly created tokens in Uniswap's proprietary core contracts." The judge ruled that the plaintiffs' concerns are better addressed to Congress rather than the court, and that Uniswap's token sales cannot be covered under the Securities Act of 1933 and the Securities Exchange Act of 1934. The judge also referred to Bitcoin and Ethereum as "crypto commodities." This ruling is significant as it highlights the ongoing debate around the regulatory status of cryptocurrencies, with the SEC and CFTC holding differing views on whether they are securities or commodities.

title: Uniswap lawsuit judge calls Ether a commodity in dismissal order - Cointelegraph
summary: Judge Katherine Polk Failla has dismissed a class-action lawsuit against Uniswap, stating that Ether (ETH) is a commodity, not a security. This ruling comes as other regulators, such as the SEC and CFTC, have tussled over jurisdiction concerning cryptocurrencies. The judge's comment is not a definitive ruling on Ether's legal classification in the US, but it adds to the ongoing debate over how to regulate digital assets. Multiple bills are currently in Congress that aim to provide regulatory clarity for digital assets, including some that would give authority to either the SEC or CFTC.

title: Robinhood Wallet Expands Crypto Offering to Add Bitcoin, Dogecoin, and Ethereum Swaps - Decrypt
summary: Robinhood Wallet, a multi-chain self-custody Web3 wallet, has expanded its crypto offerings to include Bitcoin, Dogecoin, and in-app Ethereum swaps. The update follows its global launch six months ago, which attracted hundreds of thousands of users across 140 countries. Robinhood Wallet now provides custody, send, and receive capabilities for Bitcoin and Dogecoin, and is delving into DeFi with in-app swaps on the Ethereum network. The company aims to keep building for its customers and is currently accessible to all iOS users, with Android support expected later this year.

Offchain Labs has launched Arbitrum Stylus, a programming environment for Arbitrum (ARB) chains that allows developers to build dApps on WASM-compatible languages. This new development makes Arbitrum Nitro operations faster and cheaper, and opens up new use cases for the blockchains of the Arbitrum ecosystem. A $20,000 bounty program has been launched to introduce the new development to the global Ethereum community. Arbitrum Stylus offers a new level of composability and modularity, allowing developers to easily call programs written in different languages without changing their codebases. The release is seen as a major milestone in terms of blockchain accessibility, as it opens up the Arbitrum ecosystem to millions of developers working on WASM languages.

title: Giddy Smart Wallet Launches Multichain Support Beginning With Ethereum - Yahoo Finance

The wallet now supports Ethereum, as well as other EVM-compatible networks such as Polygon, Arbitrum, Base, and Binance Smart Chain. Giddy's advanced private key technology allows users to manage their private keys without writing down or storing a seed phrase, enhancing security and user experience. The wallet also offers in-app fiat-to-crypto purchases, token swaps, sends, and shopping with thousands of recognized brands across 150 countries. Giddy aims to make decentralized finance accessible to all with its user-friendly and secure mobile app.

title: U.S. District Court Judge Labels Ether and Bitcoin as "Crypto Commodities" in Dismissal of Lawsuit Against Uniswap - Yahoo Finance
summary: U.S. District Court Judge Katherine Polk Failla dismissed a class-action lawsuit against Uniswap, a decentralized exchange, while categorizing Ethereum and Bitcoin as "crypto commodities." The judge's decision highlights the unique nature of cryptocurrencies and diverges from recent legal actions that have treated certain cryptocurrencies differently. The SEC and CFTC are debating jurisdictional rights concerning cryptocurrencies, with the SEC claiming jurisdiction over everything except Bitcoin, while the CFTC argues that cryptocurrencies, including Ether, should be treated as commodities. Lawmakers have introduced various bills in Congress aimed at bringing clarity to the regulatory landscape for cryptocurrencies, proposing different solutions, including categorizing cryptocurrencies as securities or commodities, and determining the regulatory authority responsible for overseeing them.

This decision is a significant boost for the cryptocurrency industry as it provides more clarity and certainty on the legal status of digital assets in the US. title: Cardano to be Bigger than Bitcoin and Ethereum? Hoskinson Reveals Why ADA is Primed to Explode - ZyCrypto
summary: Charles Hoskinson, the founder of Cardano, believes that his blockchain will become the "biggest cryptocurrency in the world" and the "backbone of a new digital nation." He highlights that Cardano's decentralized nature and on-chain governance set it apart from other blockchains like Bitcoin and Ethereum, which rely on a single party for control. Cardano aims to be a platform that encompasses voting, money, and all aspects of our digital lives, with a focus on creating a more equitable and fair society. While technical challenges remain, Hoskinson's vision for Cardano's potential impact is ambitious.

title: Robinhood expands crypto wallet to include Bitcoin, Dogecoin, and Ethereum swaps - Cryptopolitan
summary: Robinhood, a commission-free brokerage, has expanded its crypto wallet to include Bitcoin, Dogecoin, and Ethereum swaps, responding to user demand for more diverse asset coverage. This move comes after a drop in crypto-related revenue and follows recent U.S. regulatory actions against major cryptocurrency exchanges. Despite this, Robinhood aims to boost its crypto business and enhance user engagement by offering more tokens, including popular ones like Bitcoin and Dogecoin. The expansion is seen as a strategic move to position Robinhood as a more versatile player in the competitive crypto market.

title: Offchain Labs launches Arbitrum Stylus to expand smart contract development on Ethereum's Layer 2 network - Cryptopolitan
summary: Offchain Labs has launched Arbitrum Stylus, a tool that expands smart contract development on Ethereum's Layer 2 network by supporting languages like Rust, C, and C++, in addition to Solidity. This aims to democratize access to Ethereum-compatible smart contract development and potentially bring 3 million Rust and C developers into the ecosystem. Arbitrum Stylus offers interoperability between different coding languages and reduces computational costs by 10-100 times, depending on the task. The tool is available on a testnet and Offchain Labs is seeking community feedback before submitting a proposal to the Arbitrum DAO.

title: How to Bridge Bitcoin to Ethereum in 2024? Read This Before Bridging - Captain Altcoin
summary: Bridging Bitcoin to Ethereum refers to the process of transferring BTC from the Bitcoin blockchain onto the Ethereum blockchain. This allows Bitcoin holders to access the Ethereum network and participate in decentralized finance (DeFi) applications built on Ethereum. There are two main methods for bridging BTC to ETH: wrapping BTC into an ERC-20 token via services like WBTC, RenBTC or tBTC, or swapping directly BTC for ETH via DEXes like RocketXchange or THORChain. Each method has its benefits and drawbacks, and the optimal choice depends on factors like the intended use case and the desired level of decentralization.

title: Robinhood Expands Crypto Wallet Support Beyond Ethereum, Adds Bitcoin and Dogecoin - Investors King Ltd
summary: Robinhood, a popular financial services company, has expanded its cryptocurrency wallet to include support for Bitcoin (BTC) and Dogecoin (DOGE), in addition to Ethereum (ETH). This move allows users to seamlessly send and receive these cryptocurrencies, diversifying the company's crypto offerings beyond the Ethereum ecosystem. Robinhood has also introduced a swap feature that enables users to trade Ether for over 200 other cryptocurrencies, without holding Ether, and network fees are automatically deducted from the tokens held. The company aims to make crypto more accessible and user-friendly with its wallet, and all users will gain access to the swap feature in the coming weeks.
